file_content.text: If you had been leading the Empire's forces, the Republic would already be crushed.
Your reputation is no accident. Mandalore has seen few like you.
Kandosii!
Amazing, you live! My congratulations. You are more worthy than any Mandalorian in the last five galactic cycles!
Speak of what you faced. Let these young ones hear the path of true valor.
Yes, please, what happened?
My vision became a black haze, but I still struck down all who came at me.
It was a good and noble rite.
It sounds glorious.
Master, I want to try the ordeal! I think I'm ready.
Do not compare yourself, lad. The training and endurance to face this test will take you many years.
You can see, your exploits will be a tale to inspire a generation.
What do you think happened?
I'm sure the details are hazy--the poison can wreak havoc with your mind. But your victory stands without question.
This foolish quest kills many of your best men. It should never be repeated.
It's a silly idea. Don't try.
Your opinions are valuable to us. Every Mandalorian on Tatooine will hear of your unlikely victory.
But do not insult our culture. Every lad here should have the same opportunity we granted you.
This is the weapon which marks your triumph. Use it in health.
You're wasting breath. The poison is killing you as we speak.
Take a breath. Your news can wait that long.
But sir, Warusman Ordo is dead! We--I--we followed him and saw... it was because of the poison. The Sand People got him!
Then he is not the best. This trial is for the best of men. That is what Warusman Ordo came to Tatooine to prove.
Do not mourn for him. The only true death is to fear to try... like the Imperial puppets who let politics dictate their lives.
I have a pretty low tolerance for insults.
Was that an insult?
Okay, I'll bite. Try what?
If you're trying to pick a fight, you're going about it all wrong.
I'm not impressed.
I'm an old man. Fighting me would mean nothing for someone like you.
Your reputations are well-known. The Empire gives you a great deal of respect.
I've heard of you, Sith Lord. The Empire says you're someone to be feared.
Now, I don't know what it is you do, but I know the Empire respects you for it.
Not that I give a bantha's backside what the Empire thinks. They backed out of a perfectly good war to hide behind a piece of paper.
If you want to change my mind, you're welcome to try.
You will learn why no one speaks this way to a Sith.
Maybe a blow to the head?
There is no threat you can pose that the Force cannot overcome.
I will earn your respect.
Prove yourself with your flesh, not by twisting my mind, and you'll have my respect to the end of my days.
You never know when the respect of the Mandalorians may come in handy.
That could be interesting.
I have my doubts you'll ever earn it.
I'm surprised you haven't sought me out already. There's only one good reason for someone like you to come to Tatooine.
You want to prove yourself worthy of the Mandalore's respect? Any Mandalorian in your shoes would have been at it already.
You set me up like that, there's only one answer I can give.
I can meet any challenge.
Spoken well.
I never sign on until I've read the fine print.
Just tell me already.
The Sand People produce a lethal poison. The only antidote is kept in their holy shrines, guarded by a sacred number of armed guards.
I'm gonna need more on the table than just your respect.
What's in it for me?
There are weapons we hold only for those who complete this trial. Those who carry them never need another.
The trial is this: The Sand People distill a lethal poison, and only their holiest shrines have the antidote. Guarded, of course.
To prove yourself, you will take the poison voluntarily and then fight your way to the antidote before you succumb.
It was this which killed Warusman Ordo, and many others who were called "hero" on different worlds. Will you take the poison?
I've survived worse.
I'll do it.
Huh. More guts than I'd have wagered.
Here it is, then. You've got the time it takes the poison to travel from your arm to your brain. By then, you'd better have the antidote in hand.
Sand People are all over the place. Finding their shrines will not be the hard part. Surviving long enough to reach them, will.
I'm no fool. [Refuse quest]
It's no wonder the Empire has gone soft.
I am not here to serve the Empire.
Su'cuy gar, friend.
